RAISED.Definition: put in a higher position, lifted

KNELT.Definition: stood with his knee or knees on the ground

AXE.Definition: a tool with a blade on a handle used also as a weapon

MONARCHY.Definition: a form of government ruled by a King or Queen

THRONE.Definition: special chair used by a King or Queen

GUILLOTINE.Definition: machine with a heavy blade held high and dropped to cut people's heads off

TURBULENT.Definition: involving lots of arguments and violence

RESTORATION.Definition: the action of returning to the previous condition, return to power

VAIN.Definition: having a high opinion of his abilities and worth

WOOL.Definition: the soft thick hair of sheep

SUSPICION.Definition: a belief that it was probably true

INCLINED.Definition: having a preference, was in favour of

RESORT TO.Definition: do it because he didn't have any other options

RADICAL.Definition: supporter of the belief that there should be great change

PREACHER.Definition: a person who gave religious speeches

UNWISELY.Definition: in a way that was likely to cause problems

BEAT THEM INTO SUBMISSION.Definition: use violence to make them obey

HUMILIATING.Definition: making him feel ashamed and foolish

SENSIBLY.Definition: in a way that showed wisdom

NO GOING BACK.Definition: not possibility for the situation to change

INCONCLUSIVE.Definition: not leading to a clear result

GUNPOWDER.Definition: an explosive mixture used in guns and cannons

AMMUNITION.Definition: material fired by a gun or canon

SIEGES.Definition: military operations in which enemy forces surround a town or castle

CAVALRY.Definition: the group of soldiers who fight on horses

INFANTRY.Definition: the group of soldiers who fight on foot

SPEARS.Definition: weapons with pointed tips on a long pole

PIKES.Definition: weapons with pointed tips on a long pole

DISCIPLINED.Definition: fighting in a very controlled way

SURRENDER.Definition: the action of accepting defeat and stopping resisting

CRITICALLY.Definition: in a way that was very important

TRIAL.Definition: the hearing of the events in a court in order to decide whether he was guilty or not

TRYING HIS LUCK.Definition: doing it in the hope that he would succeed

HANDED OVER.Definition: given to parliament to decide his fate

STOOD TRIAL.Definition: judged in a court of law

LEGALITY.Definition: the fact that it was allowed by the law

PROCESSION.Definition: a line of people moving forward as a part of a celebration or ceremony

COSTUME.Definition: set of clothes typical of that period of history

WAVING.Definition: moving up and down as a greeting or sign

MARTYRDOM.Definition: the death of someone because of his beliefs or position

FUGITIVE.Definition: someone who was running away from danger

CONSTITUTION.Definition: ideas or principles according to which the state should be governed

RULEBOOK.Definition: standards or regulations that should be followed

SINISTER.Definition: giving the impression of something harmful or evil

ORWELLIAN.Definition: characteristic of the writings of George Orwell

INFLUENTIAL.Definition: having a big effect on people and things, important

NOT UP TO THE JOB.Definition: not suitable for or good at that job

EXILED.Definition: having been removed from his own country due to political reasons

PARTY ANIMAL.Definition: a very outgoing person who enjoys having fun at social activities

ARISTOCRACY.Definition: a class of people with high social rank

ILLEGITIMATE.Definition: born of parents not lawfully married to each other

RESENTMENT.Definition: a feeling of deep displeasure and anger

BRUTALLY.Definition: in a cruel and violent way

MASSACRE.Definition: act of killing a lot of people

CULMINATED.Definition: reached its highest point of development

ANCESTOR.Definition: a relative who had lived in the past

APPARENT.Definition: easy to be seen or understood

PROSPERITY.Definition: the state of being successful, especially financially

LAID THE FOUNDATIONS.Definition: provided the basis or the basic ideas for

POWER-HUNGRY.Definition: having a strong desire for power

DEATH WARRANT.Definition: official order for his execution or death penalty

PUNISH.Definition: cause suffering to someone who has done something wrong

DUG UP.Definition: removed from the ground where he had been buried

PROUDLY.Definition: in an impressive and confident way

CAMPAIGNING.Definition: asking in an organised and planned  way
